radiographic_examinations.findings: The visualized lung bases are clear without any focal opacities, pleural effusions or pneumothorax. The liver enhances homogeneously without any focal hepatic lesions. The gallbladder is unremarkable without any radiopaque gallstones. The spleen is normal in size and shape. The pancreas enhances homogeneously without any focal lesions or ductal dilation. The adrenal glands are normal in size and shape bilaterally. The kidneys enhance symmetrically, with peripelvic cysts present bilaterally. Contrast excretion is seen bilaterally. The ureters are normal. The stomach and small bowel appear unremarkable. The appendix is dilated, measuring 12 mm with fat stranding around it. Associated ileal wall thickening is noted. The large bowel contains stool without evidence of wall thickening or obstruction. Diverticulosis is noted, without evidence of diverticulitis. No intra-abdominal free air or free fluid. The bladder is moderately distended and unremarkable. No inguinal or pelvic sidewall lymph node enlargement by CT size criteria. The abdominal aorta is of normal caliber without aneurysm or dilation. The visualized osseous structures are unremarkable.
